intro: Boechera rigidissima, commonly known as the rigid bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, white or pale purple flowers. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Boechera rigidissima is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
